intro: Erigeron oligocephalus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron oligocephalus is often found in disturbed areas and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
